chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvatore T Castrogiovanni was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court orders that the unpaid court costs are to be reduce to a civil judgment.

[MK] case called at 11:13am. 
Defendant Salvatore T Castrogiovanni in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (DA Happ submits the victim impact statement and restitution information); the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Castrogiovanni guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Castrogiovanni on Probation for three years, with conditions:
--to serve six months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on June 5, 2015 at 6:00pm.
--the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this jail term to Rock County or any other county, conditional on it being at no additional cost to Jefferson County taxpayers and condition on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term
--to obtain financial planning and/or financial management training, if deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay restitution of $2205.43 to Grad-Tech Pavers
--to pay the 10% restitution processing fee of $220.54
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  279 days
After DA Happ confirms that there is a DNA sample on file for Mr. Castrogiovanni, the Court indicates it is not ordering DNA sample provision as a condition of Probation, however the payment of the $250 DNA surcharge is required.
DA Happ will submit a proposed Order for Disbursement in regard to the $200 amount paid toward restitution by Mr. Castrogiovanni earlier today. [The $2205.43 restitution amount listed as a condition of Probation already credits the Defendant for this payment; the original restitution amount due was $2405.43.]
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given
recess 11:44am.


NEXT:  DA Happ will submit a proposed Order to Disburse the restitution funds that were paid today
Jury trial on May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on May 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 8:35 am

case called at 10:17am. 
Defendant Salvatore T Castrogiovanni appears via videoconferencing from DCI, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Samantha Humes appears in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence at Grade Tech Pavers
--not to possess any financial documents of any other person
--to be booked at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office on this case prior to any release from incarceration 

Attorney Humes indicates that Mr. Castrogiovanni is now at DCI; he was transferred there related to a Dane County case sentence last week. 
Attorney Humes indicates that Mr. Castrogiovanni's DOC number is:  #190202.
recess 10:22am
